subject: Boston Marathon
Airlines and Airplanes
lead_paragraph: The No. 1549 Patrick Harten will wear on his chest for the Boston Marathon is no ordinary bib assignment: Race organizers gave it to Harten, a New York air traffic controller, to honor his role in the safe landing of US Airways Flight 1549 in the Hudson River. Harten, who began running three years ago, wrote to Boston Marathon organizers last month, requesting the number. Race organizers do not generally allow runners to pick their bib numbers for fear of opening the door to every hoofer with a lucky number.
